targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    m.name AS model_name,
    SUM(c.tokens_sent) AS "Total Tokens Sent",
    SUM(c.tokens_received) AS "Total Tokens Received"
FROM 
    public.chats c
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON c.conversation_id = conv.id
JOIN 
    public.prompts p ON c.prompt_id = p.id
JOIN 
    public.models m ON p.model_id = m.id
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)
GROUP BY 
    m.name
ORDER BY 
    m.name;

WITH user_activity AS (
    SELECT
        u.id AS user_id,
        DATE_TRUNC('month', c.created_at) AS activity_month, -- Truncate the chat activity to month
        COUNT(DISTINCT DATE(c.created_at)) AS active_days      -- Count distinct active days per user
    FROM
        public.users u
    JOIN 
        public.conversations conv ON u.id = conv.user_id      -- Join users and conversations
    JOIN 
        public.chats c ON conv.id = c.conversation_id         -- Join conversations and chats
    WHERE
        c.created_at > u.created_at                           -- Only count activity after the registration day
        AND $__timeFilter(c.created_at)                       -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the chats
    GROUP BY
        u.id, DATE_TRUNC('month', c.created_at)               -- Group by user and month
),
monthly_active_users AS (
    SELECT
        activity_month,                   -- Month of activity
        COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS MAU    -- Count distinct active users for the month
    FROM
        user_activity
    WHERE
        active_days > 0                   -- Ensure the user was active at least one day different from registration
    GROUP BY
        activity_month                    -- Group by the month
    ORDER BY
        activity_month                    -- Order by the activity month for time series
)
SELECT
    activity_month,
    MAU                                    -- Number of active users for each month
FROM
    monthly_active_users;

panels.description: Based on Chat table, the number of unique registered users using system in that week

targets.rawSql:
WITH active_users AS (
    SELECT
        users.id AS user_id,                               -- User ID
        DATE_TRUNC('week', chats.created_at) AS week       -- Truncate the chat creation date to the week
    FROM
        users
    JOIN
        conversations ON users.id = conversations.user_id  -- Join users with conversations
    JOIN
        chats ON chats.conversation_id = conversations.id  -- Join conversations with chats
    WHERE
        $__timeFilter(chats.created_at)                    -- Filter based on selected time range in Grafana
    GROUP BY
        users.id, week                                     -- Group by user ID and week
)
SELECT
    week,                                                  -- Week
    COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS active_user_count           -- Count of distinct active users per week
FROM
    active_users
GROUP BY
    week
ORDER BY
    week;                                                  -- Order by week for time series

WITH weekly_registrations AS (
    -- Count users registered in each week
    SELECT
        DATE_TRUNC('week', u.created_at) AS week,   -- Truncate registration date to the week
        COUNT(u.id) AS weekly_new_registrations     -- Count of users registered in that week
    FROM
        public.users u
    WHERE
        $__timeFilter(u.created_at)                 -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected period
    GROUP BY
        week
),
active_users AS (
    -- Get active users (users who have had chats) in each week
    SELECT
        DATE_TRUNC('week', c.created_at) AS week,   -- Truncate chat activity to the week
        conv.user_id                                -- Get user ID from conversations
    FROM
        public.chats c
    JOIN
        public.conversations conv ON c.conversation_id = conv.id -- Join chats with conversations to get user_id
    WHERE
        $__timeFilter(c.created_at)                 -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected period
    GROUP BY
        week, conv.user_id                          -- Group by week and user ID to find unique active users per week
),
active_non_new_users AS (
    -- Find active users who did not register in the same week they were active
    SELECT DISTINCT
        au.week,
        au.user_id
    FROM
        active_users au
    LEFT JOIN
        public.users u ON au.user_id = u.id
    WHERE
        DATE_TRUNC('week', u.created_at) != au.week -- Exclude users who registered the same week they were active
)
-- Final output
SELECT
    wr.week,                                                   -- Week (starting on Monday)
    wr.weekly_new_registrations,                               -- New user registrations in the week
    SUM(wr.weekly_new_registrations) OVER (ORDER BY wr.week) AS running_total_users, -- Running total of registered users
    COUNT(anu.user_id) AS active_non_new_users                 -- Active users who were not registered that same week
FROM
    weekly_registrations wr
LEFT JOIN
    active_non_new_users anu ON wr.week = anu.week             -- Join with active users who are not new
GROUP BY
    wr.week, wr.weekly_new_registrations
ORDER BY
    wr.week;

panels.title: Active Weekly Users

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    COUNT(DISTINCT users.id) AS active_users_count  -- Count distinct active users
FROM
    public.users
JOIN
    public.conversations ON users.id = conversations.user_id  -- Join users with conversations
JOIN
    public.chats ON chats.conversation_id = conversations.id  -- Join conversations with chats
WHERE
    chats.created_at >= DATE_TRUNC('week', CURRENT_DATE)      -- Filter for chats within the current week
    AND chats.created_at < DATE_TRUNC('week', CURRENT_DATE) + INTERVAL '1 week';

SELECT 
    DATE_TRUNC('day', created_at) AS day,  -- Group by day
    COUNT(*) AS total_chats_via_frontend               -- Total number of rows for each day
FROM 
    public.chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(created_at)            -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time range
GROUP BY 
    day                                  -- Grouping by day
ORDER BY 
    day;

SELECT 
    DATE_TRUNC('day', created_at) AS day,  -- Group by day
    COUNT(*) AS total_api_chats               -- Total number of rows for each day
FROM 
    public.api_chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(created_at)            -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time range
GROUP BY 
    day                                  -- Grouping by day
ORDER BY 
    day;

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,                   -- Add the user email
    c.*                                    -- Select all fields from chats table
    
FROM 
    public.chats c
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON c.conversation_id = conv.id  -- Join chats to conversations
JOIN 
    public.users u ON conv.user_id = u.id                     -- Join conversations to users
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)     
order by c.created_at desc                          -- Apply Grafana time filter on chats
LIMIT 500;

SELECT *
FROM api_chats
WHERE $__timeFilter(created_at) -- assuming you have a 'created_at' column
LIMIT 500;

WITH date_series AS (
    SELECT 
        generate_series(
            (SELECT MIN(created_at::date) FROM public.chunks WHERE $__timeFilter(created_at)), 
            (SELECT MAX(created_at::date) FROM public.chunks WHERE $__timeFilter(created_at)), 
            '1 day'::interval
        )::date AS day
),
daily_totals AS (
    SELECT 
        created_at::date AS day, 
        COUNT(*) AS total_rows
    FROM 
        public.chunks
    WHERE 
        $__timeFilter(created_at)
    GROUP BY 
        created_at::date
)

SELECT 
    ds.day,
    COALESCE(dt.total_rows, 0) AS total_rows  -- Use COALESCE to show 0 for missing days
FROM 
    date_series ds
LEFT JOIN 
    daily_totals dt ON ds.day = dt.day
ORDER BY 
    ds.day;

WITH daily_totals AS (
    SELECT 
        created_at::date AS day, 
        COUNT(*) AS total_rows
    FROM 
        public.chunks
    WHERE 
        $__timeFilter(created_at)  -- Add time filter here
    GROUP BY 
        day
),
today_total AS (
    SELECT 
        COUNT(*)::numeric AS total_today
    FROM 
        public.chunks
    WHERE 
        created_at::date = CURRENT_DATE
        AND $__timeFilter(created_at)  -- Add time filter here
),
total_days AS (
    SELECT 
        (CURRENT_DATE - MIN(created_at::date)) + 1 AS days_elapsed
    FROM 
        public.chunks
    WHERE 
        $__timeFilter(created_at)  -- Add time filter here
),
average_total AS (
    SELECT 
        COALESCE(SUM(total_rows) / NULLIF((SELECT days_elapsed FROM total_days), 0), 0)::numeric AS avg_total
    FROM 
        daily_totals
)
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN a.avg_total > 0 THEN (t.total_today / a.avg_total) * 100
        ELSE 0
    END AS percentage_of_average
FROM 
    today_total t, 
    average_total a;

panels.title: Today's Chunks as % of Average Daily Chunks

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    COUNT(d.id) AS document_count
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.datasets ds ON ds.created_by = u.id  -- Link users to datasets through created_by
JOIN 
    public.documents d ON d.dataset_id = ds.id  -- Link datasets to documents
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(d.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time range selection on documents' creation time
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    document_count DESC  -- Order by the number of documents in ascending order
LIMIT 10;

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    COUNT(d.id) AS document_count
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.datasets ds ON ds.created_by = u.id  -- Link users to datasets through created_by
JOIN 
    public.documents d ON d.dataset_id = ds.id  -- Link datasets to documents
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(d.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time range selection on documents' creation time
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    document_count DESC  -- Order by the number of documents in ascending order
LIMIT 10;

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    SUM(c.tokens_sent) AS total_tokens_sent
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON conv.user_id = u.id  -- Link users to conversations
JOIN 
    public.chats c ON c.conversation_id = conv.id    -- Link conversations to chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time period
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    total_tokens_sent DESC  -- Order by total tokens sent in descending order
LIMIT 10;  -- You can adjust the limit as needed

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    SUM(c.tokens_sent) AS total_tokens_sent
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON conv.user_id = u.id  -- Link users to conversations
JOIN 
    public.chats c ON c.conversation_id = conv.id    -- Link conversations to chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time period
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    total_tokens_sent DESC  -- Order by total tokens sent in descending order
LIMIT 10;  -- You can adjust the limit as needed

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    SUM(c.tokens_received) AS total_tokens_received
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON conv.user_id = u.id  -- Link users to conversations
JOIN 
    public.chats c ON c.conversation_id = conv.id    -- Link conversations to chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time period
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    total_tokens_received DESC  -- Order by total tokens received in descending order
LIMIT 10;  -- You can adjust the limit as needed

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,
    SUM(c.tokens_received) AS total_tokens_received
FROM 
    public.users u
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON conv.user_id = u.id  -- Link users to conversations
JOIN 
    public.chats c ON c.conversation_id = conv.id    -- Link conversations to chats
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)  -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time period
GROUP BY 
    u.email
ORDER BY 
    total_tokens_received DESC  -- Order by total tokens received in descending order
LIMIT 10;  -- You can adjust the limit as needed

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,                          -- User email for identification
    COUNT(c.id) AS total_chats                      -- Total number of chats per user
FROM 
    public.chats c
JOIN 
    public.conversations conv ON conv.id = c.conversation_id
JOIN 
    public.users u ON u.id = conv.user_id           -- Join users via conversations
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(c.created_at)                     -- Apply Grafana's time filter for selected time range
GROUP BY 
    u.email                                         -- Group by user email
ORDER BY 
    total_chats DESC                                -- Order by total chats in descending order
LIMIT 10;                                           -- Limit to top 10 users

SELECT 
    (u.email || ' : ' ||  ak.api_key) as user,                -- Stored hash from the api_keys table
    COUNT(ac.id) AS total_chats         -- Count of rows in api_chats
FROM 
    public.api_chats ac
JOIN 
    public.api_keys ak ON ak.id = ac.api_key_id  -- Join api_chats with api_keys on api_key_id
JOIN 
    public.users u ON u.id = ak.user_id         -- Join api_keys with users on user_id
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(ac.created_at)                -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time range
GROUP BY 
    u.email, ak.api_key                          -- Group by user email and hashed API key
ORDER BY 
    total_chats DESC                            -- Order by total chats in descending order
LIMIT 10;                                       -- Limit to top 10 users

SELECT
  users.email AS email,                             -- User's email
  users.created_at AS created_at,                   -- User's creation date
  MAX(chats.created_at) AS last_chat_datetime,      -- The last chat datetime
  STRING_AGG(teams.name, ', ' ORDER BY teams.name) AS team_names  -- Aggregated team names
FROM 
  users
LEFT JOIN 
  conversations ON users.id = conversations.user_id    -- Join conversations to users
LEFT JOIN 
  chats ON chats.conversation_id = conversations.id    -- Join chats to conversations
LEFT JOIN 
  team_users ON team_users.user_id = users.id          -- Join team_users to users
LEFT JOIN 
  teams ON team_users.team_id = teams.id               -- Join teams to team_users
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(users.created_at)                      -- Apply Grafana's time filter for user creation
GROUP BY
  users.email,                                         -- Group by user email
  users.created_at                                     -- Group by user creation date
ORDER BY
  created_at DESC;                             -- Order by last chat datetime in descending order

WITH date_series AS (
    SELECT 
        generate_series(
            $__timeFrom()::date, 
            $__timeTo()::date, 
            '1 day'::interval
        )::date AS day
),
user_creations AS (
    SELECT 
        users.created_at::date AS day, 
        COUNT(*) AS total_users
    FROM 
        users
    WHERE 
        $__timeFilter(users.created_at)  -- Ensure it uses the time range selected in Grafana
    GROUP BY 
        day
)
SELECT 
    ds.day, 
    COALESCE(uc.total_users, 0) AS total_users  -- Replace NULL with 0 for days with no users
FROM 
    date_series ds
LEFT JOIN 
    user_creations uc ON ds.day = uc.day
ORDER BY 
    ds.day;

SELECT 
    created_at::date AS upload_date,          -- Extract the date part from the created_at timestamp
    COUNT(*) AS total_documents               -- Count the number of documents uploaded on each day
FROM 
    public.documents
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(created_at)                 -- Filter by the selected Grafana time period
GROUP BY 
    upload_date                               -- Group by the upload date
ORDER BY 
    upload_date ASC;                          -- Order by the date in ascending order

SELECT 
    u.email AS user_email,              -- User's email from the users table
    COUNT(d.id) AS total_documents      -- Count of documents uploaded by the user
FROM 
    public.documents d
JOIN 
    public.datasets ds ON ds.id = d.dataset_id     -- Join documents with datasets
JOIN 
    public.users u ON u.id = ds.created_by         -- Join datasets with users via created_by
WHERE 
    $__timeFilter(d.created_at)                    -- Apply Grafana's time filter for the selected time range
GROUP BY 
    u.email                                        -- Group by user email
ORDER BY 
    total_documents DESC                           -- Order by total documents in descending order
LIMIT 10;                                          -- Limit to top 10 users
